titles.title: School Rumble: Ichi Gakki Hoshuu
School Rumble: First Extra Term
Школьный переполох OVA
School Rumble OVA
喧嚣学园 第一学期补习
SR OVA
sukuran ova
スクールランブル一学期補習
School Rumble: Extra Class
School Rumble: Nachhilfe

recommendations.recommendation: Looking for comedy? This is one of the best out there. It`s absolutely hilarious! All seasons and OVAs are really funny!

anime.description: * Based on the manga by http://anidb.net/cr1197 [Kobayashi Jin]. New-Term Excitement! — One day http://anidb.net/ch126 [Sarah], an exchange student, defends http://anidb.net/ch124 [Yakumo]`s cat friend http://anidb.net/ch148 [Iori], and both lonely girls become good friends. To Be Near You Scramble! — In the new term, http://anidb.net/ch72 [Tenma] is in the same class as http://anidb.net/ch73 [Ooji], and the seat assignments will be changing. Tenma desperately hopes to sit next to Ooji. Yakumo slept through much of art class, and stays behind to finish her sketch, when she encounters a http://anidb.net/ch34030 [ghost-girl] who knows of Yakumo`s ability to read minds. The Naked Truth! — At the hot springs the imagination runs wild. Smile, Please! — Working at Was Burger http://anidb.net/ch74 [Mikoto] is quite popular with the customers, but as http://anidb.net/ch77 [Kyousuke] finds out, asking Lora for a smile can be painful. Mammoth, Yum! — A look into the distant past, 10,000 years ago, when man lived a much more precarious life. Especially when the gigantic mammoth Devil Tusk appeared. May I Fall in Love? — Yakumo is helping Kenji finish his manga when there is a blackout. By candlelight romance is in the air... somewhat. — written by foo2 Note: A series of shorts related to the first http://anidb.net/a2165 [School Rumble] series filling in a few gaps in the story.

tag.name: maintenance tags
tag.description: These tags are used for maintenance.

tag.name: shounen
tag.description: In the context of manga and associated media, shounen, literally meaning "youth" and often also specifically "boy", refers to a male audience roughly between the ages of 10 and 18. Source: Wikipedia

tag.name: high school
tag.description: A secondary school that usually contains grades 10 through 12 in Japan, or 9 through 12 in America.

tag.name: delinquent
tag.description: Delinquents - Every school has them, but not all anime with school setting make delinquents a central topic. There are several versions of these delinquents, though some are grounded on a misunderstanding: * The student with a really bad image and attitude, based on his real criminal actions outside of the school and is even feared by teachers. * The primitive "class bully" that pushes around ("clobbers") his classmates for no apparent reason, possibly extorting lunch money. * The student with an sinister complexion or "evil eye", but is actually a "good" student (unfoundedly feared character). * The rebellious student, who does not care for studying, but is otherwise docile. Called a "delinquent" as a joke.

tag.name: target audience
tag.description: Anime, like everything else in the modern world, is targeted towards specific audiences, both implicitly by the creators and overtly by the marketing. While categories are associated with specific sex and age groups, this is not a bar on the anime being enjoyed by people who don`t fit into that band; not only do crossover titles exist, but the categories also have a considerable following outside their main demographic, and a person might as well enjoy anime from all categories. Still, does not invalidate the usefulness of marking a title as one of the categories; the same themes will likely be treated differently in anime geared for different audiences. Only one should not jump the gun and assume that a title will be more or less serious or present content in this or that way due to its target audience, or conversely assume the target audience on the content and its presentation alone. As such, the audience categories help form a broad impression of how a title might work with the announced themes, but offer little to no in-depth information about specific content or its treatment. The audience categories originate from manga magazines, which group titles of a same intended audience into a magazine that is advertised as belonging to that category, and so manga-based anime will have the category from their parent work. As for anime based on other works, the audience is often debatable, but comparing information such as time slot to the manga-based anime generally helps figure out the most likely possibility. If the parent material was classified under multiple audiences over time (for example, it was originally shounen, but then as the plot changed and became more mature, it was reclassified as seinen), and the anime adapts parent material time periods covering multiple audiences, we tag all audiences covered by the anime adaptation.

tag.name: themes
tag.description: Themes describe the very central elements important to the anime stories. They set the backdrop against which the protagonists must face their challenges. Be it School Life, present Daily Life, Military action, Cyberpunk, Law and Order detective work, Sports, or the Underworld. These are only but a few of the more typical backgrounds for anime plots. Add to that a Conspiracy setting with a possible tragic outcome, the Themes span most of the imaginable subject matter relevant to anime.

tag.name: original work
tag.description: What the anime is based on! This is given as the original work credit in the OP. Mostly of academic interest, but a useful bit of info, hinting at the possible depth of story.

tag.name: setting
tag.description: The setting describes in what time and place an anime takes place. To a certain extent it describes what you can expect from the world in the anime.

tag.name: elements
tag.description: Next to Themes setting the backdrop for the protagonists in anime, there are the more detailed plot Elements that centre on character interactions: "What do characters do to each other or what is done to them?". Is it violent Action, an awe-inspiring Adventure in a foreign place, the gripping life of a Detective, a slapstick Comedy, an Ecchi Harem anime, a SciFi epic, or some Fantasy travelling adventure?

tag.name: time
tag.description: This placeholder lists different epochs in human history and more vague but important timelines such as the future, the present and the past.

tag.name: place
tag.description: The places the anime can take place in. Includes more specific places such as a country on Earth, as well as more general places such as a dystopia or a mirror world.

tag.name: present
tag.description: Somewhere between past and future.

tag.name: past
tag.description: Anime that takes place in the past or clearly seems to take place in the past in case of an alternative universe. This category should almost always go together with one of its sub-categories, because the past can either be a depiction of a historical event(s) or not, in which case it would be alternative past.

tag.name: Earth
tag.description: The Earth is the third planet from the Sun, and the densest and fifth-largest of the eight planets in the Solar System. It is in effect a ball of hot mud, but on the surface it`s cold enough, so most of us live on it (or are supposed to). It is circa 4.5 billion years old, and, unless we humans succeed in destroying it over the next couple of centuries, it is expected to last for quite another while, though the changes in the Sun`s emissions due to its aging will likely cause the extinction of everything; the species of earthlings are guaranteed to die, even if we fail to kill them -- unless, of course, we find ourselves another planet and figure out a way to take everything there. Our little planet on a corner of this galaxy may mean nothing in the grand scheme of things, but to its inhabitants it is their home, so, as a species, we cherish it dearly, to the point many cultures even to this day deify it. Being the home to the human civilizations, the Earth is the main setting of most fiction, be it anime or otherwise, but not only are many titles set in other places, such as unrelated fantasy worlds, in a considerable number of fictional titles the Earth is actually destroyed by aggressive alien invaders.

tag.name: slapstick
tag.description: Slapstick humour is generally recognized by lots of physical abuse, horseplay and practical jokes. Also often seen are impossible situations, using sounds to illustrate impossible stunts that aren`t shown on-screen and to create tension for audience anticipation.

tag.name: parody
tag.description: Anime that imitate other stories (can be from TV, film, books, historical events, ...) for comic effect by exaggerating the style and changing the content of the original. Also known as spoofs. It can also refer to when whole elements of one work are lifted out of their context and reused.

tag.name: Japan
tag.description: Japan is a sovereign island nation in East Asia. Located in the Pacific Ocean, it lies off the eastern coast of the Asian mainland and stretches from the Sea of Okhotsk in the north to the East China Sea and China in the southwest. Source: Wikipedia

tag.name: unrequited love
tag.description: At least one character has a romantic interest in another one, but the feelings are not returned. This is the cornerstone of all love triangles or love polygons.

tag.name: love polygon
tag.description: A love polygon refers to a romantic relationship involving n people. Although a love triangle is not limited to just heterosexual relationships, in anime, it usually deals with two females liking one male and vice versa.

tag.name: manga
tag.description: Manga is the lifeblood that drives the anime industry. Everything and its mother is based on manga. However! There are exceptions where the manga was not the basis for the anime. It`s common practice to make manga adaptations of many popular anime, there`s a manga based on Evangelion, and two (one shounen and one shoujo) based on each of Escaflowne and Mahou Tsukai Tai. Also it`s quite common to release manga and anime versions of a story in parallel, for instance Nadesico and Shoujo Kakumei Utena. There are also cases where an anime continues in a manga, as in the case of Angel Beats! and Angel Beats: Heaven`s Door, or reverse. See also http://anidb.net/t6493 [manhua] and http://anidb.net/t5010 [manhwa].

tag.name: Asia
tag.description: Asia is Earth`s largest and most populous continent, located primarily in the eastern and northern hemispheres and sharing the continental landmass of Eurasia with the continent of Europe. Asia covers an area of 44,579,000 square kilometers, about 30% of Earth`s total land area and 8.7% of the Earth`s total surface area. The continent, which has long been home to the majority of the human population, was the site of many of the first civilizations. Asia is notable for not only its overall large size and population, but also dense and large settlements as well as vast barely populated regions within the continent of 4.4 billion people. Source: Wikipedia

tag.name: comedy
tag.description: Anime whose central struggle causes hilarious results. These stories are built upon funny characters, situations and events. A comedy anime is laced with humour and sets out to provoke laughter from the audience. Japanese humour can be a bit strange to westerners, so if you`re new to this type of humour, just bear with it; it`ll most likely grow on you if you`re a fan of other kinds of comedy.

tag.name: romance
tag.description: Romance describes a story that deals with love between two or more characters typically also having an optimistic ending. Romance is also a difficulty encountered when creating a harem.

tag.name: school life
tag.description: Since a large part of the anime audience still takes part in school life or is visiting college, it is only natural to choose a setting the audience can identify with, be it elementary, middle, or high school. For the older viewers a college setting with more mature real-life problems is appropriate. And since clubs take up so much time in the lives of students, these are obviously also important.

tag.name: parental abandonment
tag.description: In Japan it is a common custom for parents to leave their children alone at home and embark on a lifelong trip around the world once they hit the tender age of 14, sometimes even earlier. Of course this is done because the parents believe their children are independent enough to get their act together. But little do they know about the small secrets their offspring has, such as a childhood fiancé(e) or even a forbidden incestuous love between their (often not-blood-related) children. Of course aside from having a huge house, financial support is provided as well. Usually through the means of MAGICAL MONEY. In rare cases the parents actually die (shortly) before embarking on their world-trip, which is self-evidently used as an important plot device in the development of the child.

tag.name: unsorted
tag.description: a bunch of tags that still need to be either deleted or moved into proper places.

tag.name: funny expressions
tag.description: The facial expressions of the characters may change so quickly or unexpectedly distort that hilarity will ensue.

tag.name: hot springs visit
tag.description: An onsen is a term for hot springs in the Japanese language, though the term is often used to describe the bathing facilities and inns around the hot springs. Often the cast of a show somehow ends up going to an onsen because of various reasons, such as winning a lottery ticket. Usually used for fanservice purpose as it gives the staff the opportunity to draw the characters nude and raise the DVD sales. Another cheap variant is the http://anidb.net/t4290 [sentou episode]. See also http://anidb.net/t2830 [furo scene], http://anidb.net/t5846 [beach episode], and http://anidb.net/t6046 [pool episode].

tag.name: facial distortion
tag.description: The characters face are exaggerated into a misshape, deformed, and almost warped. Used as comedy element to express extreme mood swings. Differing from "http://anidb.net/t2652 [Super Deformed]", here only the face changes to an extreme degree, not the whole body of the protagonist.

tag.name: watercolour style
tag.description: A watercolour or aquarelle is a painting method in which the paints are made of pigments suspended in a water-based solution. Some anime are created in the style of watercolour paintings, the watercolour style, usually with faded pastels that often give the show a warm and friendly visual presentation. In modern anime, this is generally achieved via computer effects that create an imitation of watercolour, rather than by creating real-life watercolour art. While the watercolour style is more commonly used for backgrounds, it is possible to create the entire anime in such a style.

tag.name: misunderstanding
tag.description: Suggests that a large portion of storyline revolves around a rather large misunderstanding between two or more characters, usually forming long lasting situations of separation or hostility between all those involved. A large portion of the story may be dedicated to gradually working all parties into a mutual understanding to true intentions or changes of heart.

tag.name: TO BE MOVED TO EPISODE
tag.description: Tags under this parent tag are going to be moved to episode tags and removed from the anime they`re currently assigned to. They will be blocked from the anime system once that move is complete. Please help with that job if you know what episodes they should be assigned to.

tag.name: technical aspects
tag.description: It may sometimes be useful to know about technical aspects of a show, such as information about its broadcasting or censorship. Such information can be found here.

character.name: Harima Kenji
character.description: Harima Kenji is the franchise`s male lead, and a nearly almighty delinquent who`s in love with http://anidb.net/ch72 [Tsukamoto Tenma]. He has the ability to communicate with animals and possesses a wide variety of strange and exotic pets.

character.name: Sawachika Eri
character.description: A close friend of Tenma. Her father is a wealthy European and her mother is Japanese. Has great difficulty with Kanji. Extremely wealthy and rather spoiled. (In Japan, western Europeans are stereotyped to be billionaires and extremely snobby.)

character.name: Tsukamoto Tenma
character.description: Tsukamoto Tenma is the female protagonist. She loves http://anidb.net/ch73 [Karasuma Ooji]. Short for her age. Good-natured and friendly, but rather dense. Enjoys professional wrestling, and has some difficulty telling the difference between professional and amateur wrestling.

character.name: Karasuma Ooji
character.description: Karasuma Ooji is a classmate of the lead characters`, and http://anidb.net/ch72 [Tsukamoto Tenma]`s love interest. He loves curry, and he is rather unusual in several ways: he enjoys dressing as a kappa, he has a complete lack of facial expression, and he also has unexpected skills such as riding a bike very fast or driving buses.

character.name: Suou Mikoto
character.description: A close friend of Tenma. Tall, well-developed, and tomboyish. Has black belt in Kenpo.

character.name: Takano Akira
character.description: A close friend of Tenma. President of the Tea Club. Likes her part-time job. Very perceptive and intelligent.

character.name: Hanai Haruki
character.description: Class rep. Childhood friend of Mikoto. Goes to the same dojo as her and has a black belt in Kenpo, too. Is hopelessly in love with Yakumo.

character.name: Imadori Kyousuke
character.description: He has the special skill of knowing a girl`s cup size just by looking. Interested only in girls with breast size D or larger, therefore he is after Mikoto fanatically who has a rather large cup size among the girls in the class, and ignores Ichijou.

character.name: Fuyuki Takeichi
character.description: Pretends to take photos of the girls in the school for the yearbook but in reality sells them to the male students.

character.name: Ichijou Karen
character.description: Ichijou has monstrous strength despite having a weak and feminine appearance and is a member of the amateur wrestling club. Her power amazes even her strongest male classmates. It would also seem that she is not able to control her strength well, as shown when she nearly suffocates Tenma when trying to cover her mouth so that she does not blurt out secrets. Lala Gonzalez is her only rival in this regard, but has not been able to physically defeat her (In fact, Ichijo defeated her with her ultimate move, the Frankensteiner). Despite this, Ichijou has not reciprocated Lala`s antagonism, always remaining polite towards her. Later the two seem to have developed into friends. Despite her strength she has a kind nature and is one of the more timid girls in 2-C. She is in love with Imadori, but gets embarrassed when this is hinted at. Imadori also initially avoids her, not only because of her small measures (later it is revealed that she does have considerably large breasts), but also because he fears her strength. She is also a good singer, and her singing is featured in episodes 2 and 6 of School Rumble - Second Term. When Imadori met her practicing wrestling and asked her why she liked it, she said that she really did not want to do wrestling. Later, when Imadori, along with Harima and Hanai were working for a moving company, they found out that Ichijou was also working with them as well as how strong she was. At the end of their shift, Imadori accidentally said that he could take Karen out on a date with his earnings, which Karen agrees to, even though Imadori did not really mean it. As the series progresses, Karen falls deeper in love with Imadori but continuously lacks the courage to act out. She is rewarded when she finally defeats him in a wrestling match however, with an indirect confession from him. Karen has a younger brother, Kousuke who, like Imadori, is also a Dojibiron fan.

character.name: Asou Hiroyoshi
character.description: Athletic character who works as a chef in the same restaurant as Sara. Also works at his family place, the Kouraku Chinese Restaurant.

character.name: Yoshidayama Jirou
character.description: A subordinate of Harima, but dreams of becoming top of the delinquent hierarchy one day.

character.name: Suga Ryuuhei
character.description: A member of basketball club, always hanging around with Asou.

character.name: Harry MacKenzie
character.description: Exchange student, skilled at fighting. Rival of Harima Kenji. (Note: Harry Mackenzie is pronounced Harii Makkenjii in Japanese)

character.name: Lala Gonzalez
character.description: An exchange student. From Mexico, she is a skilled practitioner of Lucha libre fighting. Sees Ichijo as a rival, often shouting "Ichi, Jo!" Belongs in the same amateur wrestling club as Ichijo.

character.name: Tougou Masakazu
character.description: 2-D Class rep., sees class C as a rival. Harry MacKenzie friend.

character.name: Tsukamoto Yakumo
character.description: Sister of Tsukamoto Tenma. She is able to read the thoughts of those who like her. She is skilled in household chores such as cooking because her older sister is lazy and unreliable. Member of the Tea Club.

character.name: Sarah Adiemus
character.description: A close friend of Yakumo. She is an exchange student from the UK, and a sister at a local church. Member of the Tea Club.

character.name: Osakabe Itoko
character.description: Physics teacher and cousin of Harima Kenji (Note: "itoko" is also the word for "cousin" in Japanese)

character.name: Sasakura Youko
character.description: Art teacher and old friend of Osakabe.

character.name: Anegasaki Tae
character.description: School infirmary nurse. Had lived with Harima Kenji in the past.

character.name: Tani Hayato
character.description: Class 2-C homeroom teacher. Teaches English. Very soft-spoken. Owns a collection of toy dinosaurs.

character.name: Iori
character.description: A black cat being taken care of by the Tsukamoto household.

episode.title: また新学期でドキドキ! / そばにいたくてジタバタ! / ハダカの君にドキューン!
New-Term Excitement! / To Be Near You Scramble! / The Naked Truth!
Mata Shingakki de Dokidoki! / Soba ni Itakute Jitabata! / Hadaka no Kimi ni Dokyuun!
スマイルください! / マンモスたべたい! / 恋してもいいですか?
Smile, Please! / Mammoth, Yum! / May I Fall in Love?
Smile Kudasai! / Mammoth Tabetai! / Koi Shite mo Ii Desu ka?
小清水亜美と能登麻美子の塚本姉妹座談会
Tsukamoto Sisters Conversation with Koshimizu Ami and Noto Mamiko
Koshimizu Ami to Noto Mamiko no Tsukamoto Shimai Zadankai
